results.title: Population ecology
results.creator_credit: Stanley Croner and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 1. Ecology”.
Shows how environmental conditions such as natural enemies and food factors can help increase or reduce births and deaths. Discusses how humans have created the birth surplus over death called the population explosion. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: What is ecology?
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 1. Ecology”.
Introduces the study of ecology by illustrating the wide variety of interrelationships between plants, animals and their environment. Introduces the major biomes of the world.

results.title: The Honourable Wally Norman
results.creator_credit: Ted Emery, Emile Sherman, Jonathan Shteinman, South Australian Film Corporation, Showtime, Ocean Pictures and AFFC
results.brief_description: From the world of politics a local hero emerges in the form of a ‘man of the people’ - Wally, Wally Norman (Kevin Harrington). Directed by Ted Emery (Kath & Kim) comes this comedy about the machinations of political life when a country town crucial for a win at the next federal election, finds itself with a dilemma. The local meat works is closed down and sleazy Ken Oath (Shaun Micallef) corrupt politician wants to win at any cost. Local man Wally Norman, unable to give speeches due to extreme fear, finally overcomes his inertia to lead the town he feels passionate about - Givens Head - and they elect their new leader. Set to the strains of Jimmy Barnes “Working Class Man”, this film pokes fun at politicians and is a cheer for the underdog. Opening night film for the Sydney Film Festival 2003. Cast includes Greig Pickhaver and Alan Cassell and was written by Andrew Jones and Rick Kalowski.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ted Emery, Emile Sherman, Jonathan Shteinman, South Australian Film Corporation, Showtime, Ocean Pictures and AFFC

results.title: The Temperate deciduous forest
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program. Unit 1. Ecology”
Illustrates the complex network of plant and animal relationships that make up the temperate deciduous forest community. Shows the adaptations of animals and deciduous plants to seasonal changes.

results.title: The Horse in the gray flannel suit
results.creator_credit: Norman Tokar, Winston Hibler and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: An advertising executive under pressure to come up with a winning campaign uses, for inspiration, his daughter’s love of horses. This children’s film, centred on horses and equestrian pursuits, is a family-oriented comedy that stars Dean Jones, Fred Bolton, Diane Baker, Lloyd Bochner, Fred Clark and Ellen Janov.

results.title: Distribution of plants and animals
results.creator_credit: William Peltz, John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 1. Ecology”.
Studies plant and animal ecology. Traces the various factors which influence the distribution and survival of animals in a given geographical area. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Sea
results.creator_credit: Michael Birch and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 1. Ecology”.
Illustrates basic concepts of marine ecology, and shows the interrelationship between living things in the sea, their dependence on each other and on the conditions of the marine environment. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Hollywood Palace
results.creator_credit: Grey Lockwood, William Harbach and Zodiac Enterprises
results.brief_description: The Hollywood Palace was a very popular long-running American variety show televised on Saturday nights from 1964-1970. Its success was mainly due to its high profile guests and variety of entertainment offered to its viewers along with the revolving core group of hosts including Sammy Davis Jr, Jimmy Durante, Don Adams, Fred Astaire, Judy Garland and the ever popular Bing Crosby. This video is a special edition of the final show hosted by Crosby which takes a look back at some of the most memorable moments with performances by Nat King Cole (“Unforgettable”), Fred Astaire and Ethel Merman (“Anything goes”), Judy Garland (“Be a clown”), Dean Martin (“Volare”), and many more. It also includes some great comedy sketches by such comedians as Jerry Lewis, Groucho Marx, Don Knots, Jack Benny, Debbie Reynolds, Phyllis Diller and Burns and Allen with some “behind-the-scenes” footage of rehearsals and bloopers by the stars. This is a travel down memory lane. An interesting footnote: the Rolling Stones made their first US TV appearance on the show in 1964. Due to the unique material contained in this program, variations may occur in picture and sound quality.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Grey Lockwood, William Harbach and Zodiac Enterprises

results.title: The Hometown
results.creator_credit: Bettina Matzkuhn, Jack Long and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A collection of tapestries designed and sewn by the filmmaker, Bettina Matzkuhn, illustrate the lyrics of a song about a young girl’s hometown. Animation is created through a combination of sewing and cinematic techniques. The needlework, done in a naive style, is well suited to the bright colours and varied textures of the work. A lively film designed to promote interest in the art of tapestry
